page.title: 14Fire at Great Billing School
page.content: On February 20th 1985 Great Billing Lower School was set on fire by 3 teenagers aged 13,14 and 15. Two classrooms were completely destroyed and damage amounted to $30,000. The 140 pupils had to be re-housed in Far Cotton Middle School while repairs took place. The boys used turpentine to start the fire and admitted causing the blaze to get rid of their finger- prints. They had broken into the School earlier and had stolen 3 cassette players and other items. Three fire engines fought the blaze for three hours before it was under control.
